4:
They wandered in the wilderness on a desert road
\q and found no city in which to live.
\q
5:
Because they were hungry and thirsty,
\q they fainted from exhaustion.
\q
6:
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
\q and he rescued them out of their distress.
\q
8:
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
\q and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
\q
9:
For he satisfies the longings of those who are thirsty,
\q and the desires of those who are hungry he fills up with good things.
\q
10:
Some sat in darkness and in gloom,
\q prisoners in affliction and chains.
11:
This was because they had rebelled against God's word
\q and rejected the instruction of the Most High.
\q
13:
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
\q and he brought them out of their distress.
14:
He brought them out of darkness and gloom
\q and broke their bonds.
\q
15:
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
\q and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
\q
16:
For he has broken the gates of bronze
\q and cut through the bars of iron.
17:
They were foolish in their rebellious ways
\q and afflicted because of their sins.
\q
18:
They lost their desire to eat any food,
\q and they came close to the gates of death.
\q
19:
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
\q and he brought them out of their distress.
20:
He sent his word and healed them,
\q and he rescued them from their destruction.
\q
21:
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
\q and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
\q
22:
Let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving
\q and proclaim his deeds in singing.
23:
Some travel on the sea in ships
\q and do business overseas.
\q
24:
These saw the deeds of Yahweh
\q and his wonders on the seas.
25:
For he commanded and aroused the windstorm
\q that stirs up the seas.
\q
26:
They reached up to the sky; they went down to the depths.
\q Their lives melted away in distress.
\q
27:
They swayed and staggered like drunkards
\q and were at their wits' end.
28:
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
\q and he brought them out of their distress.
\q
29:
He calmed the storm,
\q and the waves were stilled.
\q
30:
Then they rejoiced because the sea was calm,
\q and he brought them to their desired harbor.
31:
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
\q and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
\q
32:
Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people
\q and praise him in the council of the elders.
33:
He turns rivers into a wilderness,
\q springs of water into dry land,
\q
34:
and a fruitful land into a barren place
\q because of the wickedness of its people.
\q
35:
He turns the wilderness into a pool of water
\q and dry land into springs of water.
36:
He settles the hungry there,
\q and they build a city to live in.
\q
37:
They build a city to plant fields in, to plant vineyards,
\q and to bring in an abundant harvest.
\q
38:
He blesses them so they are very numerous.
\q He does not let their cattle decrease in number.
39:
They were diminished and brought low
\q by painful distress and suffering.
\q
40:
He pours contempt on the leaders
\q and causes them to wander in the wilderness, where there are no roads.
41:
But he protects the needy from affliction
\q and cares for his families like a flock.
\q
42:
The upright will see this and rejoice,
\q and all wickedness shuts its mouth.
\q
43:
Whoever is wise should take note of these things
\q and meditate on Yahweh's acts of covenant faithfulness.
